subSections.title: 3.1 Eligibility
subSections.content: Users must be authorized healthcare professionals, institutions, or individuals acting within legal and regulatory guidelines. By using Open Health, you confirm that you have the legal capacity to enter into this agreement.

subSections.title: 3.2 Account Registration
subSections.content: Users must provide accurate and complete information when creating an account. Open Health reserves the right to suspend or terminate accounts with false or misleading information.

subSections.title: 3.3 Security and Access
subSections.content: Users are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of login credentials. Unauthorised access, sharing, or use of another user’s account is strictly prohibited.

subSections.title: 4.1 Data Collection and Use
subSections.content: Open Health collects and processes personal and health-related data in accordance with the Protection of Personal Information Act (POPIA) and other applicable laws. We do not sell or share patient data with unauthorised third parties.

subSections.title: 4.2 Security Measures
subSections.content: Open Health implements industry-standard security measures, including encryption, access control, and audit logs. Despite security efforts, Open Health is not liable for unauthorised access due to user negligence.

subSections.title: 4.3 Data Retention
subSections.content: Data will be retained as required by law and healthcare regulations. Users may request data deletion, subject to legal and regulatory obligations.

subSections.title: 5.1 Fees and Billing
subSections.content: Open Health operates on a subscription-based model, with fees outlined in your service agreement. Payments must be made as per the agreed billing cycle. Late payments may result in service suspension.

subSections.title: 5.2 Refund Policy
subSections.content: Fees are generally non-refundable except in cases of billing errors or service failures caused by Open Health.
